verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron and said,

verses.kjv: When a man shall have in the skin of his flesh a rising, a scab, or bright spot, and it be in the skin of his flesh like the plague of leprosy; then he shall be brought unto Aaron the priest, or unto one of his sons the priests:
verses.ct: "If someone develops a swelling, a rash, or a shiny patch on their skin that might be a serious skin disease, that person must be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons who serve as priests.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall look on the plague in the skin of the flesh: and when the hair in the plague is turned white, and the plague in sight be deeper than the skin of his flesh, it is a plague of leprosy: and the priest shall look on him, and pronounce him unclean.
verses.ct: The priest will examine the infected area on the skin. If the hair in the affected spot has turned white and the sore appears to go deeper than the surface of the skin, it is a serious skin disease. After examining the person, the priest must declare them unclean.

verses.kjv: If the bright spot be white in the skin of his flesh, and in sight be not deeper than the skin, and the hair thereof be not turned white; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague seven days:
verses.ct: However, if the shiny patch on the skin is white but does not appear to go deeper than the surface, and the hair in it has not turned white, then the priest must isolate the infected person for 7 days.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall look on him the seventh day: and, behold, if the plague in his sight be at a stay, and the plague spread not in the skin; then the priest shall shut him up seven days more:
verses.ct: On the 7th day, the priest will examine the person again. If the sore appears unchanged and has not spread on the skin, the priest must keep the person in isolation for another 7 days.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall look on him again the seventh day: and, behold, if the plague be somewhat dark, and the plague spread not in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean: it is but a scab: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
verses.ct: The priest will examine the person again on the 7th day. If the sore has faded and has not spread on the skin, the priest must declare the person clean — it is only a rash. The person must wash their clothes, and they will be clean.

verses.kjv: But if the scab spread much abroad in the skin, after that he hath been seen of the priest for his cleansing, he shall be seen of the priest again:
verses.ct: But if the rash continues to spread on the skin after the person has been examined by the priest for their cleansing, they must go back to the priest for another examination.

verses.kjv: And if the priest see that, behold, the scab spreadeth in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a leprosy.
verses.ct: If the priest sees that the rash has spread on the skin, the priest must declare the person unclean — it is a serious skin disease.

verses.kjv: When the plague of leprosy is in a man, then he shall be brought unto the priest;
verses.ct: When someone has a serious skin disease, they must be brought to the priest.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall see him: and, behold, if the rising be white in the skin, and it have turned the hair white, and there be quick raw flesh in the rising;
verses.ct: The priest will examine them. If there is a white swelling on the skin that has turned the hair white, and there is raw, exposed flesh within the swelling,

verses.kjv: It is an old leprosy in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean, and shall not shut him up: for he is unclean.
verses.ct: it is a chronic skin disease. The priest must declare the person unclean. There is no need to isolate them, because they are clearly unclean.

verses.kjv: And if a leprosy break out abroad in the skin, and the leprosy cover all the skin of him that hath the plague from his head even to his foot, wheresoever the priest looketh;
verses.ct: If the skin disease breaks out and covers the entire body of the infected person from head to foot — everywhere the priest can see —

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall consider: and, behold, if the leprosy have covered all his flesh, he shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: it is all turned white: he is clean.
verses.ct: then the priest must examine them carefully. If the disease has covered their whole body, the priest must declare the infected person clean. Since it has all turned white, the person is clean.

verses.kjv: But when raw flesh appeareth in him, he shall be unclean.
verses.ct: But whenever raw flesh appears on them, they will be unclean.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall see the raw flesh, and pronounce him to be unclean: for the raw flesh is unclean: it is a leprosy.
verses.ct: The priest must examine the raw flesh and declare the person unclean. The raw flesh is unclean — it is a serious skin disease.

verses.kjv: Or if the raw flesh turn again, and be changed unto white, he shall come unto the priest;
verses.ct: But if the raw flesh changes back and turns white again, the person must go to the priest.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall see him: and, behold, if the plague be turned into white; then the priest shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: he is clean.
verses.ct: The priest will examine them, and if the sore has turned white, the priest must declare the infected person clean. They are clean.

verses.kjv: The flesh also, in which, even in the skin thereof, was a boil, and is healed,
verses.ct: When someone has had a boil on their skin that has healed,

verses.kjv: And in the place of the boil there be a white rising, or a bright spot, white, and somewhat reddish, and it be shewed to the priest;
verses.ct: and in the place where the boil was, a white swelling or a shiny spot appears that is white with a reddish tint, the person must show it to the priest.

verses.kjv: And if, when the priest seeth it, behold, it be in sight lower than the skin, and the hair thereof be turned white; the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague of leprosy broken out of the boil.
verses.ct: The priest will examine it, and if it appears to go deeper than the surrounding skin and the hair in it has turned white, the priest must declare the person unclean. It is a serious skin disease that has broken out from the boil.

verses.kjv: But if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hairs therein, and if it be not lower than the skin, but be somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:
verses.ct: But if the priest examines it and finds no white hair in it, and it is not deeper than the surrounding skin but has faded, then the priest must isolate the person for 7 days.

verses.kjv: And if it spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague.
verses.ct: If it spreads significantly on the skin, the priest must declare the person unclean — it is a disease.

verses.kjv: But if the bright spot stay in his place, and spread not, it is a burning boil; and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
verses.ct: But if the shiny spot remains in place and does not spread, it is just a scar from the boil, and the priest must declare the person clean.

verses.kjv: Or if there be any flesh, in the skin whereof there is a hot burning, and the quick flesh that burneth have a white bright spot, somewhat reddish, or white;
verses.ct: When someone has a burn on their skin, and the healing flesh of the burn develops a shiny spot that is white with a reddish tint, or just white,

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall look upon it: and, behold, if the hair in the bright spot be turned white, and it be in sight deeper than the skin; it is a leprosy broken out of the burning: wherefore the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.
verses.ct: the priest must examine it. If the hair in the shiny spot has turned white and it appears to go deeper than the skin, it is a serious skin disease that has broken out from the burn. Therefore the priest must declare the person unclean — it is a serious skin disease.

verses.kjv: But if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hair in the bright spot, and it be no lower than the other skin, but be somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:
verses.ct: But if the priest examines it and finds no white hair in the shiny spot, and it is not deeper than the surrounding skin but has faded, then the priest must isolate the person for 7 days.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall look upon him the seventh day: and if it be spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.
verses.ct: The priest will examine the person on the 7th day. If it has spread significantly on the skin, the priest must declare the person unclean — it is a serious skin disease.

verses.kjv: And if the bright spot stay in his place, and spread not in the skin, but it be somewhat dark; it is a rising of the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him clean: for it is an inflammation of the burning.
verses.ct: But if the shiny spot remains in place and has not spread on the skin but has faded, it is just swelling from the burn. The priest must declare the person clean, because it is simply inflammation from the burn.

verses.kjv: If a man or woman have a plague upon the head or the beard;
verses.ct: When a man or woman develops a sore on the scalp or in the beard area,

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall see the plague: and, behold, if it be in sight deeper than the skin; and there be in it a yellow thin hair; then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a dry scall, even a leprosy upon the head or beard.
verses.ct: the priest must examine the sore. If it appears to go deeper than the skin and there is thin, yellowish hair in it, the priest must declare the person unclean. It is a scaly infection — a serious disease of the scalp or beard.

verses.kjv: And if the priest look on the plague of the scall, and, behold, it be not in sight deeper than the skin, and that there is no black hair in it; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague of the scall seven days:
verses.ct: But if the priest examines the scaly infection and it does not appear deeper than the skin, yet there is no dark hair in it, the priest must isolate the person with the scaly infection for 7 days.

verses.kjv: And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the plague: and, behold, if the scall spread not, and there be in it no yellow hair, and the scall be not in sight deeper than the skin;
verses.ct: On the 7th day, the priest will examine the sore. If the scaly infection has not spread and there is no yellowish hair in it, and the infection does not appear deeper than the skin,

verses.kjv: He shall be shaven, but the scall shall he not shave; and the priest shall shut up him that hath the scall seven days more:
verses.ct: the person must shave the area around the infection, but not shave the infected spot itself. Then the priest must isolate the person with the scaly infection for another 7 days.

verses.kjv: And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the scall: and, behold, if the scall be not spread in the skin, nor be in sight deeper than the skin; then the priest shall pronounce him clean: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
verses.ct: On the 7th day, the priest will examine the scaly infection. If it has not spread on the skin and does not appear deeper than the surface, the priest must declare the person clean. They must wash their clothes, and they will be clean.

verses.kjv: But if the scall spread much in the skin after his cleansing;
verses.ct: But if the scaly infection spreads significantly on the skin after the person has been declared clean,

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall look on him: and, behold, if the scall be spread in the skin, the priest shall not seek for yellow hair; he is unclean.
verses.ct: the priest must examine them. If the scaly infection has spread on the skin, the priest does not need to look for yellowish hair — the person is unclean.

verses.kjv: But if the scall be in his sight at a stay, and that there is black hair grown up therein; the scall is healed, he is clean: and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
verses.ct: But if, in the priest's judgment, the scaly infection has not changed and dark hair has grown in it, the infection has healed. The person is clean, and the priest must declare them clean.

verses.kjv: If a man also or a woman have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, even white bright spots;
verses.ct: When a man or woman develops shiny spots — white shiny spots — on their skin,

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall look: and, behold, if the bright spots in the skin of their flesh be darkish white; it is a freckled spot that groweth in the skin; he is clean.
verses.ct: the priest must examine them. If the shiny spots on the skin are a dull white, it is a harmless rash that has developed on the skin. The person is clean.

verses.kjv: And the man whose hair is fallen off his head, he is bald; yet is he clean.
verses.ct: If a man loses the hair on the back of his head, he is simply bald. He is still clean.

verses.kjv: And he that hath his hair fallen off from the part of his head toward his face, he is forehead bald: yet is he clean.
verses.ct: If a man loses the hair from the front of his head, he has a receding hairline. He is still clean.

verses.kjv: And if there be in the bald head, or bald forehead, a white reddish sore; it is a leprosy sprung up in his bald head, or his bald forehead.
verses.ct: But if a reddish-white sore appears on the bald area at the back or front of the head, it is a serious skin disease developing on the bald spot.

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall look upon it: and, behold, if the rising of the sore be white reddish in his bald head, or in his bald forehead, as the leprosy appeareth in the skin of the flesh;
verses.ct: The priest must examine it. If the swelling of the sore on the bald area at the back or front of the head is reddish-white, looking like a serious skin disease elsewhere on the body,

verses.kjv: He is a leprous man, he is unclean: the priest shall pronounce him utterly unclean; his plague is in his head.
verses.ct: the person has a serious skin disease and is unclean. The priest must absolutely declare them unclean — the disease is on their head.

verses.kjv: And the leper in whom the plague is, his clothes shall be rent, and his head bare, and he shall put a covering upon his upper lip, and shall cry, Unclean, unclean.
verses.ct: Anyone who has such a serious skin disease must wear torn clothes, leave their hair uncombed, cover the lower part of their face, and call out, 'Unclean! Unclean!'

verses.kjv: All the days wherein the plague shall be in him he shall be defiled; he is unclean: he shall dwell alone; without the camp shall his habitation be.
verses.ct: For as long as they have the disease, they remain defiled. They are unclean and must live alone, staying outside the camp.

verses.kjv: The garment also that the plague of leprosy is in, whether it be a woollen garment, or a linen garment;
verses.ct: When a fabric is contaminated with what appears to be a mildew-like disease, whether it is wool or linen,

verses.kjv: Whether it be in the warp, or woof; of linen, or of woollen; whether in a skin, or in any thing made of skin;
verses.ct: whether in the lengthwise threads or the crosswise threads of linen or wool, or in leather, or in anything made from leather,

verses.kjv: And if the plague be greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it is a plague of leprosy, and shall be shewed unto the priest:
verses.ct: if the contamination in the fabric, leather, woven material, knitted material, or leather item appears greenish or reddish, it is a mildew-like contamination and must be shown to the priest.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall look upon the plague, and shut up it that hath the plague seven days:
verses.ct: The priest will examine the contamination and isolate the affected item for 7 days.

verses.kjv: And he shall look on the plague on the seventh day: if the plague be spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in a skin, or in any work that is made of skin; the plague is a fretting leprosy; it is unclean.
verses.ct: On the 7th day, the priest will examine the contamination. If it has spread in the fabric — whether in the lengthwise or crosswise threads — or in the leather or anything made from leather, it is a destructive mildew. The item is unclean.

verses.kjv: He shall therefore burn that garment, whether warp or woof, in woollen or in linen, or any thing of skin, wherein the plague is: for it is a fretting leprosy; it shall be burnt in the fire.
verses.ct: The priest must burn the fabric — whether the lengthwise or crosswise threads of wool or linen — or any leather item that is contaminated, because it is a destructive mildew. It must be destroyed by fire.

verses.kjv: And if the priest shall look, and, behold, the plague be not spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin;
verses.ct: But if the priest examines it and the contamination has not spread in the fabric — whether in the lengthwise or crosswise threads — or in any leather item,

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall command that they wash the thing wherein the plague is, and he shall shut it up seven days more:
verses.ct: then the priest must order that the contaminated item be washed, and he must isolate it for another 7 days.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall look on the plague, after that it is washed: and, behold, if the plague have not changed his colour, and the plague be not spread; it is unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it is fret inward, whether it be bare within or without.
verses.ct: After the item has been washed, the priest will examine the contamination. If it has not changed in appearance, even though it has not spread, the item is unclean. You must burn it in the fire — the decay has eaten into it, whether on the inside or the outside.

verses.kjv: And if the priest look, and, behold, the plague be somewhat dark after the washing of it; then he shall rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof:
verses.ct: But if the priest examines it and the contamination has faded after washing, he must tear the affected section out of the fabric, leather, or woven material.

verses.kjv: And if it appear still in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it is a spreading plague: thou shalt burn that wherein the plague is with fire.
verses.ct: If the contamination reappears in the fabric — in the lengthwise or crosswise threads — or in any leather item, it is an active outbreak. You must burn the contaminated item in the fire.

verses.kjv: And the garment, either warp, or woof, or whatsoever thing of skin it be, which thou shalt wash, if the plague be departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time, and shall be clean.
verses.ct: But if the contamination disappears from the fabric — whether lengthwise or crosswise threads — or from any leather item after washing, it must be washed a 2nd time, and then it will be clean.

verses.kjv: This is the law of the plague of leprosy in a garment of woollen or linen, either in the warp, or woof, or any thing of skins, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean.
verses.ct: These are the regulations for dealing with mildew-like contamination in wool or linen fabric — whether in the lengthwise or crosswise threads — or in any leather item, for determining whether it is clean or unclean."
